intro: Mandevilla mandonii, commonly known as the pink mandevilla, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a vine that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink and red. The plant has heart-shaped, glossy leaves and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and as a houseplant. Mandevilla mandonii requires well-draining soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
